explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 84degC (open cup flash test) (HSDB (2006)), which is classified into Category 4

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin) and a distorted ring structure

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 500mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 597mg/kg (SIDS (2002) and 500mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 470mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 480mg/kg (SIDS (2002)) and 470mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-38 (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to data gaps and deficiencies, with the rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation) value of 0.26mg/L (equivalent to 45ppm) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)) and LC0 (4 hour inhalation) of 2.39mg/L (SIDS (2002)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (4 hour application) (SIDS (2002)): "The substance induced moderate to severe skin irritant reactions such as necrosis with mild to moderate edema." Also based on the descriptions of irritation tests: "Skin responses included redness, edema and bulla on days 1-2, subcutaneous bleeding and ulcer formation on day 3, hardening and thickening of the epidermis with fissure and hyperpigmentation on day 5," "Pathological changes included epidermal degeneration and necrosis, disappearance of cell boundaries, occurrence of pinkish blots, dermal hemorrhage, infiltration of lymphocytes, and abscess formation" (though these results are not those of 4 hour application). Although classified into Category 1A-1C, the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (SIDS (2002)): "The substance produced moderate to severe corneal damage, with no recovery observed over the subsequent 7 days." Also due to the fact that it is classified into Category 1A-1C for skin irritation. The substance is thus considered severely irritating to the eye.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on the positive results in allergy reaction tests on guinea pigs (SIDS (2002)) along with two epidemiological case reports of positive reactions in humans (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), and no positive data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo (UDS tests), described in Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1997), SIDS (2002), NTP DB (Access on Mar., 2006) and CERI Hazard Data 2000-38 (2001).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of decreased fertility and increased incidence of resorption at doses causing parental toxicity, described in Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1997), MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004) and SIDS (2002).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies: "changes in the lung, thorax and respiration" following inhalation exposure (SIDS (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (nervous system, cardiovascular system, liver, kidneys, respiratory organs)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies "damage to the central nervous system, cardiovascular system, liver and kidneys," "hyperplasia of the nasal tissues/epithelium of the respiratory tract" (SIDS (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96 hours LC50=2.8mg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipest) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals (1996) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 94% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.81 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
